results.title: Concrete on the farm: making good concrete
results.brief_description: Making good concrete improvements on the farm. Strong, durable, economical and fireproof, they improve the property in value and appearance. Step by step, we follow the methods of concreting a holding yard for pigs; the selection, testing and cleaning, screenings, gravel and sand; preparing the foundation; marking the bay areas; pouring; levelling the surface; the non-slip finish; curing and finally ready for use. Other improvements to fence posts, silos and cowyards are shown.

Other improvements to fence posts, silos and cowyards are shown.

results.title: Concrete city
results.creator_credit: Frontyard Films, Mandy King and Fabio Cavadini
results.brief_description: This thought-provoking film about a small community of working class people who live in the old wharfside Sydney suburb of Pyrmont, brings into question the notion of coummunity participation in major urban development schemes. The development, in this case, involves nothing less than the total destruction of a community and of valuable heritage sites, for the construction of a casino and a whole range of high rise commercial development. The community is “consulted” and “involved”, yet their own suggestions as to how best develop the area are largely ignored.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frontyard Films, Mandy King and Fabio Cavadini

results.title: Concorde gives up smoking
results.creator_credit: British Aircraft Corporation and Aerospatiale France
results.brief_description: Production models of Concorde will have smoke-free engines. The imporvements made are illustrated by the comparison of production line engines with the prototypes.

results.title: Concorde
results.brief_description: Concerned with the background to Concorde, in particular some of the problems which occurred when designing and building an airliner for supersonic flight. Covers various aspects of the problem including: pioneering problems, airframe stresses, design, temperature problem, structure and assembly. Contains some animated sequences. Narrated by Nick Reid.

results.title: Concerto grosso modo
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Yves Leduc and Francois Aubry
results.brief_description: An animated film about the magic of music. A group of musicians plays on stage. Suddenly, the audience is drawn through a cello into a mysterious world where musical notes assume human qualities. They discover how music is made. A combination of live action and cel animation emphasizes the transition from reality to fantasy. The film works as entertainment and as a teaching tool for children and adults. Film without words.

results.title: Concerto for orchestra
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Malcolm Otton and Robert Parker
results.brief_description: The life and work of members of the Sydney Symphony Orchestra and its resident conductor, Dean Dixon, the off-duty hobbies and pastimes of members of the orchestra, ranging from surf fishing and motor racing to violin making and chess. Highlight is an invitation by the conductor to kindergarten children to play the instrument of their choice. Features music of Bela Bartok.

results.title: Concerto for ads and heads
results.brief_description: A day in the life of one of Melbourne’s television stations, as filmed off the screen, one frame in every 10 seconds in 1979. A powerful observation of the content of ‘our box in the corner’ 20 years ago. Set to the music of Bach.
results.description: A day in the life of one of Melbourne’s television stations, as filmed off the screen, one frame in every 10 seconds in 1979. A powerful observation of the content of ‘our box in the corner’ 20 years ago. Set to the music of Bach.

results.title: Con motto
results.brief_description: A policeman on point duty ‘conducts’ the traffic of a big city. Activity gets faster and faster as people go about their everyday life. Everybody enjoys the fantasy until the authorities arrive, reprimand the policeman and restore normality. Music only - no commentary.

results.title: Comradeship
results.creator_credit: Nero-Film, Gaumont, Franco-Film, Aubert Film and G Pabst
results.brief_description: The dramatic story of a mining disaster shortly after World War I on the French-German border. Post war tension and bitterness are put aside when the German miners help rescue their French comrades. Emphasising worker solidarity. In German and French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nero-Film, Gaumont, Franco-Film, Aubert Film and G Pabst
